summary: This is a forwarded email chain from April 26, 2020, discussing a potential meeting regarding victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence involves an FBI agent, attorney Robert C. Josefsberg, and Brittany Henderson, concerning therapeutic services for victims.

persons.name: Robert C. Josefsberg
persons.context: An attorney who represents some of the victims of Jeffrey Epstein and is attempting to set up a telephone call to discuss therapeutic services.

persons.name: Britton Henderson
persons.context: Recipient of an email from Robert Josefsberg regarding therapeutic services for Epstein victims; appears to be involved in providing or discussing such services.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Sent an email to Robert Josefsberg regarding victims of Jeffrey Epstein, likely initiating the contact about therapeutic services.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the perpetrator whose victims are the subject of the email discussion regarding therapeutic services.

connections.description: Josefsberg represents some of the victims of Jeffrey Epstein, indicating an attorney-client relationship with the victims regarding the Epstein case.
Josefsberg is attempting to set up a telephone call with Britton Henderson to discuss therapeutic services for Epstein victims.
Both are correspondents in the email chain regarding therapeutic services for Epstein victims; likely colleagues or associated in this context.

events.title: Email Discussion on Epstein Victims' Services
events.description: Email correspondence involving Robert C. Josefsberg, Britton Henderson, and Brittany Henderson regarding setting up a call to discuss therapeutic services available for victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: Attorney Robert C. Josefsberg represents some of the victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
There was a prior 'Miami meeting' referenced in the email chain regarding Epstein victims.
The correspondence focuses on organizing therapeutic services for victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
